feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 18 at 2:27PM AKST until December 20 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT AKST SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, with localized amounts up to 10 inches, and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch are expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 12:26PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated water levels along the West Coast Sunday and Monday... A strong weather system moving to the West Coast will bring elevated water levels to the coast south of the Bering Strait Sunday night and Monday and north of the Bering Strait on Monday. Water levels are expected to be 3 to 6 feet above the normal high tide line. Water levels will be similar to the system that brought
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 9:22PM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Clarke County through 1015 PM CST... At 922 PM CST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles north of Coffeeville, or 19 miles south of Butler, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 10:55AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN AND TRAVEL IMPACTS STARTING TUESDAY, LIKELY EXTENDING THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE YEAR.... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada next week. There will be few, if any, meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin on Tuesday, so plan ahead.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 17 at 8:54AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...COLD WEATHER WILL CAUSE ICE FORMATION ON THE MISSOURI RIVER... With another stretch of cold temperatures in store through the weekend and into next week, the Missouri River is making another attempt to initiate ice along the Burleigh and Morton counties reach of the river. Ice sheets are moving through the Bismarck and Mandan area of the river. What is uncertain is whether or not these ice

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 10:55AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ACTIVE WEATHER PATTERN AND TRAVEL IMPACTS STARTING TUESDAY, LIKELY EXTENDING THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE YEAR.... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada next week. There will be few, if any, meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin on Tuesday, so plan ahead.
